args.natural_language_statement: Prove that SO(n) = {A in O(n) : det A = 1} is a matrix group. In Lean4/Mathlib: state that the set of n×n orthogonal matrices with determinant 1 is a subgroup of the general linear group (i.e., closed under multiplication and inverse and contains identity). End the statement with := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable (R : Type _) (n : Type _) [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n] [CommRing R]

/-- Special orthogonal group SO(n,R) as units (invertible matrices) with A^T * A = I and det A = 1. -/
def SO : Set ((Matrix n n R)ˣ) := {A | (A : Matrix n n R)ᵀ * (A : Matrix n n R) = 1 ∧ Matrix.det (A : Matrix n n R) = 1}

/-- SO(n,R) is a subgroup of the group of invertible n×n matrices. -/
theorem SO_is_subgroup : Subgroup ((Matrix n n R)ˣ) := by
  -- proof omitted
  sorry

import Mathlib

open Matrix

variable {n : Type _} [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n]

/-- Special orthogonal group SO(n) as units (invertible matrices) with A^T * A = I and det A = 1. -/
def SO : Set ((Matrix n n ℝ)ˣ) := {A | (A : Matrix n n ℝ)ᵀ * (A : Matrix n n ℝ) = 1 ∧ Matrix.det (A : Matrix n n ℝ) = 1}

/-- SO(n) is a subgroup of the group of invertible n×n real matrices. -/
def SO_is_subgroup : Subgroup ((Matrix n n ℝ)ˣ) := by
  -- proof omitted
  sorry
